page.title: 05CHANGING TIMES(cont.)
page.content: In the early 1960's the road which passes the school used to be a farm track. The name Pennington comes from the name Penny Farm,a local farm for which a penny rent was paid.No trace remains of this farm today. The women of Pennington,up to the last war,used to take in washing from the people of Lymington.This was done to augment their husbands' wages.The women would dry the washing on gorse bushes on the Common.They used Donkey Carts to carry the washing to and from Lymington.Pennington got the name of Donkey Town after this.Some villagers still call it by that name today. Newlands Manor,a large country house,used to be owned by the Cornwallis-West family.Among the list of people who stayed there are the Kaiser and Lilly Langtry.
